result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad A. Krosinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs are due in full within 60 days. Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day in jail for each $25 left unpaid.

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.
Defendant has paid restitution in full to the District Attorney's Office.  District Attorney's Office ordered to release the funds to the Victim.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad A. Krosinski

defendant.name: Krosinski, Chad A.
defendant.address: 105 1/2 S 9th Street, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Restitution modified to 0 as defendant gave check to District Attorney's office and they paid victim. 10% surcharge paid to Clerk of Courts

11:36 AM Defendant Chad A. Krosinski in court.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carly June Sebion in court for Chad A. Krosinski. State in compliance with victim notification. Restitution has been paid in full plus 10% surcharge. Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1. 

Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Theft-Movable Property contrary to 943.20(1)(a)(3a). Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: All restitution & surcharge has been paid up front. Joint recommendation for costs only & DNA. Funds released to victim. 

Court adopts recommendation: Pay $9981.00 restitution plus surcharges. JOC direct restitution to be paid to victim. Pay costs of $443.00, pay in full w/in 60 days. Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.
